intro: Wedelia jacquinii subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered wedelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
